The neonatal mortality rate is calculated as the number of neonatal deaths (deaths within the first 28 days of life) per 1,000 live births in a given year. Step 1: Identify the number of neonatal deaths. In this case, it's 450. Step 2: Identify the number of live births. In this case, it's 12,450. Step 3: Divide the number of neonatal deaths by the number of live births. This gives us 0.036. Step 4: Multiply the result by 1,000 to get the neonatal mortality rate per 1,000 live births. This gives us 36.
